text.0: the mortal man whom ye the twain indra and agni help in fight.
text.1: breaks through een stronglyguarded wealth as tṛta burst his way through reeds.
text.2: the twain invincible in war worthy to be renowned in frays.
text.3: lords of the fivefold people these indra and agni we invoke.
text.4: impetuous is their strength and keen the lightning of the mighty pair.
text.5: which from their arms speeds with the car to vṛtras slayer for the kine.
text.6: indra and agni we invoke you both as such to send your cars.
text.7: lords of quickcoming bounty ye who know chief lovers of the song.
text.8: these who give increase day by day gods without guile for mortal man.
text.9: worthy themselves i honour most two gods as partners for my horse.
text.10: the strengthbestowing offering thus to indraagni hath been paid as butter purified by stones.
text.11: deal to our princes high renown deal wealth to those who sing your praise deal food to those who sing your praise.
